abstract: About half of nonprofit health insurance cooperatives created under Affordable Care Act have folded due to lack of funding and experience and inability to compete with established insurers; mass shutdowns will affect half-million consumers and may provide ammunition to Republicans campaigning against health law.
lead_paragraph: About a half a million consumers are hunting for coverage after 11 of the 23 nonprofit companies created in the Affordable Care Act failed.

headline.main: Failed Co-ops Add Ammunition to G.O.P. War on Health Law
headline.print_headline: Fresh Fuel for G.O.P.’s War on Health Law

snippet: About a half a million consumers are hunting for coverage after 11 of the 23 nonprofit companies created in the Affordable Care Act failed.
